p: Of 251 youth included in this analysis (median age = 20, 25 th and 75 th percentile [Q1, Q3] = 16, 21), 65.3% identified as women, and 6.0% (n = 15) as LGB. The majority of participants were either currently in school or had completed some post-secondary education at time of interview (64.5%), lived in formal housing (68.9%), with a higher proportion of young men than woman (81.6% vs. 62.2%, p = 0.02). Only one-third of participants reported making more than 1601 ZAR/month (~ 125 USD), with men significantly more likely to report higher monthly income than women (41.4% vs. 27.4%, p = 0.04).
